definition: square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly

sentences.english: The Oedipus business comes nearer to home.
sentences.chinese: 伊迪帕斯在朝家的方向走。

sentences.english: But in the third week of May, currents drew some of the oil southeast.
sentences.chinese: 但到了5月的第三周，洋流开始把浮油带向东南方向。

sentences.english: The direction of light reflected from an object depends on its alignment.
sentences.chinese: 光线的方向会根据对象的位置发生反射。

sentences.english: A simple hierarchical coarse-to-fine edge detection method based on the direction of potential edge elements is given.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种基于边界点方向的新的边界检测方法。

sentences.english: Finally, some advice was put forward on the research directions of FOD tolerance design technology in China.
sentences.chinese: 最后对我国外物损伤容限设计的研究方向提出了建议。

sentences.english: Keep the cable coils stacked in the same order as they were when they were on the drum.
sentences.chinese: 在鼓轮上保持钢索盘的旋转方向与原来一致。

sentences.english: SSDs are where things are going.
Have reached a shopping direction, sales and customers purchase contract signed.
sentences.chinese: 已达成购物方向后，销售人员和客户签署购销合同。

sentences.english: Form-filling guides and the required courses for specialization could be found in the application form.
sentences.chinese: 填表说明及专业方向对应课程详见申请表。

sentences.english: All sub-assemblies can be oriented in direction as required by the customer.
sentences.chinese: 所有子配件均可按用户要求的方向进行定位。

sentences.english: Zero stock is the best way for inventory control.
sentences.chinese: 零库存是库存管理最好的发展方向。

sentences.english: My life has no direction without her.
sentences.chinese: 没有了她，我的生活就失去了方向。

sentences.english: The bladder is thin-walled and closed by a one-way valve.
sentences.chinese: 浮囊具有薄壁的结构并且通过单方向的阀门关闭。

sentences.english: In June the equatorial trade winds reversed direction from westward to eastward.
sentences.chinese: 六月赤道信风相反的方向从西到东。

sentences.english: These cooperative enterprises will eventually be turned into joint stock companies.
sentences.chinese: 农村股份合作企业发展的方向是股份制。

sentences.english: The drawbacks and the development trend of PLSS are put forward in the end.
sentences.chinese: 最后，提出了其存在的缺点和未来发展方向。

definition: to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
direction/strike (i.e. angle of inclination in geology)/inclination/trend/to move towards/to head for
itinerary/route/political line (e.g. right revisionist road)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to go forward/to forge ahead/to advance/onward
to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
to turn one's head/to turn round/to turn about
toward/to face/to open onto/to turn towards/orientation/exposure/Qibla (Islam)
